oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Charlie Louvin interview - Biff Collie Happy Hour - 1983-01-04
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Recording of an interview with Charlie Louvin (performer), conducted by Biff Collie for his radio program Happy Hour on January 4, 1983.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Charlie Louvin does Happy Hour introductions -- Charlie Louvin talks about an upcoming Bluegrass Festival -- Louvin talks about his original name being Loudermilk -- Louvin talks about where he and his brother got the name Louvin -- Louvin talks about how successful the Louvin Brothers are among their peers -- Louvin talks about the Ira Louvin harmony -- Louvin talks about playing bluegrass festivals -- Louvin talks about being friends with Johnny Cash and meeting him when he was a child -- Louvin talks about the inspirations behind some Louvin Brother's tunes -- Louvin talks about how Ira and himself began singing together -- Louvin talks about being irritated by people talking over their singing -- Louvin talks about their record The Knoxville Girl -- Louvin tells the story about how the Louvin Brothers got onto the Grand Ole Opry, which occurred from a lie -- Louvin tells a story about a crazed fan while on tour -- Louvin talks about his favorite song of all time being At The Cross -- Louvin talks about his feelings towards religious expression and not being a hypocrite -- Louvin talks about his mother and father
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Louvin Brothers; Louvin, Charlie, 1927-2011;
